page.title: 10Industry - Distillers
page.content: At the west end of the village of Auchtertool there is a collection of buildings owned by the Distillers Company Ltd. The buildings were first used as a brewery from 1650. In the 18th Century the brewery was noted throughout Fife for its excellent brew and had its praises sung by the local poets. In 1845 it was converted to a Distillery by Walter Bartholomew from Kirkcaldy. The Whisky was a pure malt and the average annual output was 86,000 gallons. It continued as a Distillery until 1927,when the present owners changed to producing malt for the use by other Distilleries. In 1971 malting was stopped and now only the duty free warehouses are used for maturing Whisky bought from other companies. It has however a small capacity and the warehousing work is carried out (cont)
